peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do I know if my Japanese art is valuable?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: There are multiple factors to consider when trying to assess the value of a Japanese print. The considerations can range from the scarcity of the actual print, as well as the version, to the condition of the print as compared to what would be considered a mint condition impression.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Valuing a Japanese print 101

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How can I find the value of my artwork for free?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: FindArtInfo.com contains price information on all kinds of fine art, oil paintings, etchings, engravings, watercolors, drawings, sculptures and much more ranging from Old Masters to Contemporary Art. With this art appraisal tool you can value your fine art by comparing it with recent auction prices of similar pieces.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Art prices, art appraisal - Search free

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How to get a free art appraisal?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: For a free appraisal, send an image and all pertinent data to the specialists at Christie's, Sotheby's, Phillips de Pury, Swans all New York City or your local auction house. They will provide an ``auction estimate'' based on the resale history for that particular artist, in the past five years.
